channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly Tipping 12 Clapton Terrace., 4th November
item.description:
Fly Tipping 12 Clapton Terrace.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping and litter along along the public footpath adjacent to Bronze Age Way, Belvedere., 4th November
item.description:
There is a significant amount of flytipping and discarded litter along along the public footpath adjacent to Bronze Age Way, Belvedere. I would be grateful if this material could be removed and that the overgrown vegetation is cut back to allow pedestrian access along the pavement please.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Greenwich Shopping Park - Fly-tipping next Asda, 4th November
item.description:
Hi there, Can council please address the issue of fly-tipping with Asda and other retailers in the Greenwich Shopping Park? It's off putting for residents and I'm shocked the retailers do not care about the surroundings. Please issue them with warmings / fines if needed to resolve this issue for good. Best, L

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homeless camp in park, 4th November
item.description:
Tents being erected in Shakespeare park. Vagrants creating mess and it smells
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Palatine Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metal fencing with sharp edges in the Widmore recreation ground next to play area, 4th November
item.description:
The temporary metal fencing has been pulled down and is lying in the woods area in the park (east part). This is rather dangerous with kids going to play in the bushes which are part of the recreation ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lewes Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation along the public footpath adjacent to Bronze Age Way, Belvedere., 4th November
item.description:
There is significant amount of overhanging trees and other vegetation along the public footpath adjacent to Bronze Age Way, Belvedere. As pedestrian access is being obstructed, I would be grateful if Bexley Council could arrange for the vegetation to be cut back and removed please.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter & fly-tipping - lack of cleaning, 4th November
item.description:
Hi there, Woolwich Road is constantly dirty and often weekly sweeps isn't done. This is unacceptable, please ensure there are at least weekly sweeping as this is a very busy road and requires regular cleaning. Best, L

Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
There is significant amount of overhanging trees and other vegetation along the public footpath adjacent to Bronze Age Way, Belvedere. As pedestrian access is being obstructed, I would be grateful if Bexley Council could arrange for the vegetation to be cut back and removed please.

item.title: Large amount of material dumped at entrance to old Aldi car park, 4th November
item.description:
Dumped general waste, perhaps from house clearance. Inside the railings put up to prevent people using the old Aldi supermarket site.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of street cleaning on Victoria Way, 4th November
item.description:
Hi there, I keep repeating to report this street as it's often full of litter and some fly-tipping spots. Please ensure sweeping takes place weekly as this is not the case at the moment and it's not acceptable. Thanks, L
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Lighting in block from the 4th floor down to ground stair well are not working and lights from 4th to 1st landing as not working.

item.title: Angrestein roundabout - fly-tipping & litter, 4th November
item.description:
Hi there, The roundabout area is constantly full of fly-tipping and litter - can you ensure this is cleaned and more frequent cleaning arranged. This is unacceptable as I keep repeating to report this area. Best, L

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned caravan located in Crabtree Manorway South, Belvedere., 4th November
item.description:
There is an abandoned caravan located in Crabtree Manorway South, Belvedere. Due to its condition, the caravan is causing a potential hazard to other vehicle users. I would be grateful if Bexley Council could take action to identify the registered owner and remove the caravan as soon as possible please.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle in Lower Road, Belvedere, 4th November
item.description:
There is an abandoned vehicle located in Lower Road, Belvedere, adjacent to the junction with Poplar Mount, Belvedere. The vehicle is on double yellow lines and is causing a potential hazard to other vehicle users. I would be grateful if Bexley Council could take action to identify the registered owner and remove the vehicle as soon as possible please.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamppost not working o.s 59 - 57 Raeburn Road, 4th November
item.description:
The lamp has been fixed twice now and again has stopped working. Please can this be fixed asap.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 4th November
item.description:
Flytipping cardboard and rubbish.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Imperial Way and Gravelwood Close, 4th November
item.description:
There is a constant problem with dog fouling on the LBB green and the pavement that runs around the corner of Imperial way onto Gravelwood Close. The green that has your 3 enormous trees on it that you never maintain. Almost everyday we are having to step over dog poo that is on the pavement and dropped driveway. Why has Bromley council not put fouling signs up? Would you like to have dog poo outside your home on a regular basis? Also you need to clean up all the heavy leaf fall from your trees. I’m sick and tired of paying hefty council tax, which clearly is not being used to maintain the area. Start fining these people who are too lazy to pick up after their dogs. And don’t get me started on the selfish ones who also let their dogs poo on our garden! Please clean up the area and stop sending workers who pretend to clean up and don’t.
Report on FixMyStreet
